Many ISP's were sending out a mass-communication letter to all customers warning of copyright infringement through downloads...
There are many websites and forums dedicated to this topic as these letters have been sent to many innocent parties who never download any file of any sort and were proved to be a non-target set letter used to try and reduce the potential of copyright infringement through illegal downloading through the ISP's in question (so they look like they are doing their bit)

I can only advise that it is very unlikely that your ISP has directly targetted you, and that your right to internet privacy IS your right, and if anyone is really that scare-mongered by these corporate nonsense fake-threats, take measures to protect your privacy!
Change DNS servers to OpenDNS and such, etc etc!

Every torrent is the users choice on whether they download it or not. 
You know if it's legal or not, and if you already purchased this product then you are well within your right to create "back-up discs" to use if you wish to avoid the risk of damage to your original discs.

AS THE TORRENT STATES:
Provided for the education purposes or purpose of creating backup discs of this set for people who have already purchased this product.
Perfectly valid!
Enjoy!

I downloaded it and it opens in divX but it is broken into smaller bits in VIDEO TS folder. I keep getting these error messages saying:  seeking functionality may be limited, This file appears to be corrupted. Seeking may be limited or behave unexpectedly. Or some small video bits will open and say: You may need an additional audio decoder to play this file. This file contains a track in an unknown format (code "65534") format. You may need to install a directshow decoder for this audio format in order to hear the soundtrack on this file. Sorry to paste specific quotes but this is all really frustrating and i'm not sure how to fix this. if you anyone has any advice I would be eternally grateful; i'm trying to integrate this program into my sons initial vocabulary development
Isnt there flash cards???

Right, i'll help clarify. 
These are DVD disc images, so you would burn them straight to DVD and they will then play on your standard DVD player.
You are obviously trying to play this on your pc as you would an ".avi" file etc, and your media player is getting confused.
Just burn to DVD, it's a ready made DVD (DVDrip!) 

And to the flash card question: yes you did get some flash cards with the official purchase but these are not needed, and are purely there as a gimmick to aid the sale. All letters, words, and sounds are included on the DVD and visual to the child. The flash cards were meant for the adult to continue with the child without any DVD aid. 

Enjoy ;-)

if your confused on how to burn this to dvd.... use image burn... the files are not iso's, you have to build them into an iso, then burn the iso to the dvd, both of which can be done with img burn...  click here for latest version... http://www.imgburn.com/index.php?act=download
p.s. " iso " is an image file, or disc image...

downloading as we speak.  Thanks!

ok to play these on computer, i use vlc, use whatever program you want. but in vlc, open the program itself then click Media---> Open disc. . . --->the disc tab should be opened then go to where you saved the dvds. click your baby can read 1 - 5 then click the Video_TS folder. it will look empty but then click select folder and there you go! Enjoy
